revised_title: The Role of Uterine Secretion in the Nutrition of the Early Embryo: A Comparative Study in Guinea-Pig and Human Placentation
tldr: The author investigates the nutrition of early embryos, particularly in guinea-pigs and humans, and suggests that uterine secretion plays a crucial role in providing nourishment before implantation. This process involves the digestion of maternal cells by trophoblastic cells, creating a protective layer that helps the embryo survive until it attaches to the uterine wall.
